intro: Thesium thunbergianum, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, mat-like growth habit and succulent stems. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, Thesium thunbergianum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
